history.content: There is no better fix. You have to drop and reenroll.

children.subject: +1, I just dropped 188 and now can't re-enroll :(

Students enrolled in 188 got the same email. How can students reenroll if the waitlists for all the discussion sections are full? The total number of waitlist spots in discussion sections is 237, but the Berkeley Academic Guide website said it should have 300 spots. Since the waitlist was full before the email was sent out, aren't all the students that signed up for discussion 999 screwed even though they might have had earlier phase 1 times?

http://classes.berkeley.edu/content/2018-spring-COMPSCI-188-001-LEC-001

Well, your phase time affects when you can enroll in courses. It never accounts for cases when you enroll / modify your schedule much later than your appointment time.

The issue only affects the handful of students who enrolled in section 99, which didn't look that high (?) when I glanced at its enrollment numbers.
My understanding is that the issue for 170, 188, and 162 basically nullifies the differences in Phase I time. Is this correct?

history.content: Hi, I enrolled in the 999 section for 170 during my Phase 1. However, today I got an email saying there was a problem and that the 999 section was removed meaning I need to drop and re-enroll. I am currently on the waitlist at position 132. If I drop and re-enroll I will be placed on the waitlist at position ~290. This significantly reduces my chances of getting into the class. What steps should I take to ensure that I don't lose my spot on the waitlist? Dropping and re-enrolling will place me at the end of the waitlist even if the section is open. I really want to take this class next semester so any advice accepted. Really hope there is a better fix :/
history.subject: CS170 Issue
